Uses of Class
arlut.csd.ganymede.server.DBSchemaEdit

Packages that use DBSchemaEdit
arlut.csd.ganymede.server   
 

Uses of DBSchemaEdit in arlut.csd.ganymede.server
 

Fields in arlut.csd.ganymede.server declared as DBSchemaEdit
private  DBSchemaEdit GanymedeXMLSession.editor
          If we are editing the server's schema from the XML source, this field will hold a reference to a DBSchemaEdit object.
private  DBSchemaEdit DBObjectBaseField.editor
          If we are being edited, this will point to an instance of a server-side schema editing class.
private  DBSchemaEdit DBObjectBase.editor
          Used to keep track of schema editing
private  DBSchemaEdit DBBaseCategory.editor
          A reference to the DBSchemaEdit object that is editing us for a client-side schema editor.
 

Methods in arlut.csd.ganymede.server that return DBSchemaEdit
private  DBSchemaEdit GanymedeXMLSession.editSchema()
          This is a copy of the editSchema method from the GanymedeAdmin class which has been modified so that it will assert a schema edit lock without requiring that the login semaphore count be zero.
 DBSchemaEdit DBObjectBase.getEditor()
          Returns the DBSchemaEdit managing changes to this DBObjectBase, or null if this DBObjectBase is not being edited.
 

Methods in arlut.csd.ganymede.server with parameters of type DBSchemaEdit
private  void DBBaseCategory.recurseDown(DBBaseCategory category, java.util.Hashtable baseHash, DBSchemaEdit editor)
          This method takes all the children of the passed-in category (both DBObjectBase objects and contained DBBaseCategory objects) and makes copies under this.
 

Constructors in arlut.csd.ganymede.server with parameters of type DBSchemaEdit

          Recursive duplication constructor.
DBObjectBase(DBObjectBase original, DBSchemaEdit editor)
          Copy constructor.
DBObjectBase(DBStore store, boolean embedded, boolean createFields, DBSchemaEdit editor)
          This constructor actually does all the work of initializing a new DBObjectBase.

          Creation constructor.
